definition: Ending of legal proceedings because a party has died or the cause no longer survives.
example: The appeal abated as no legal heirs continued it.

definition: When an accused hides to avoid arrest or trial.
example: The accused was marked as absconding during investigation.

definition: A court judgment that the accused is not guilty.
example: He was granted acquittal due to weak evidence.

definition: Temporary order passed until a detailed hearing is held.
example: The court issued an ad interim stay on demolition.

definition: Formal decision-making by a court or authority.
example: The matter is pending adjudication before the tribunal.

definition: A statement accepting a fact, used as evidence.
example: His admission supported the prosecution case.

definition: Volens no longer a crime but still a divorce ground.
example: She sought divorce on grounds of adultery.

definition: A sworn written statement used as evidence.
example: He filed an affidavit of evidence.

definition: A more serious form of an offence due to cruelty, weapon use or repeated conduct.
example: The assault became aggravated due to knife use.

definition: Proof accused was somewhere else during the offence.
example: CCTV footage confirmed his alibi.

definition: Financial support paid to spouse after divorce or separation.
example: The court granted interim alimony.

definition: Correction of written pleadings with court permission.
example: Plaintiff sought amendment to add new facts.

definition: A neutral legal expert appointed to assist the court.
example: High Court appointed an amicus in the PIL.

definition: Bail granted before arrest under Section 438 CrPC.
example: He applied for anticipatory bail fearing arrest.

definition: Request to a higher court to review a lower court’s decision.
example: He filed an appeal challenging conviction.

definition: Private dispute resolution with a binding decision.
example: The contract required disputes to go to arbitration.

definition: Stage where charges are formally read to the accused.
example: He entered a not-guilty plea at arraignment.

definition: Taking a person into custody under authority of law.
example: Police made an arrest based on CCTV evidence.

definition: Court-ordered seizure of property to secure claims.
example: Court ordered attachment of his bank account.

definition: Document transferring rights from one party to another.
example: He executed an assignment deed for lease rights.

definition: Witness confirming a document was signed.
example: Sale deed requires attestation by two witnesses.

definition: Offence where bail must be granted as a right.
example: Theft below certain value is bailable.

definition: Written promise ensuring the accused will appear in court.
example: He signed a bail bond of ₹30,000.

definition: Expiry of legal time for filing a case.
example: The claim was dismissed as barred by limitation.

definition: Person receiving benefit under a will or policy.
example: She is the beneficiary of the trust.

definition: Highest standard of proof required in criminal cases.
example: Guilt must be proven beyond reasonable doubt.

definition: Facts giving rise to the right to sue.
example: Non-payment created cause of action.

definition: Request to court to hear a person before issuing orders.
example: He filed a caveat to prevent ex parte order.

definition: Final police report detailing evidence against accused.
example: Charge sheet filed within 90 days.

definition: Court-decided guardianship of a minor child.
example: Mother received interim custody.

definition: Offence where police may arrest without warrant.
example: Murder is cognizable.

definition: Appointment of a person to inspect property or record evidence.
example: Local commissioner inspected disputed land.

definition: Money awarded for loss or injury.
example: Victim received compensation for negligence.

definition: Court decree based on mutual settlement.
example: Parties settled and received compromise decree.

definition: Voluntary admission of guilt.
example: Extrajudicial confession must be corroborated.

definition: Disobedience of court orders or disrespect toward court.
example: He was fined for contempt.

definition: Legally enforceable agreement between parties.
example: The contract required timely delivery.

definition: Claim filed by defendant against plaintiff in same suit.
example: He filed counter claim for damages.

definition: Questioning a witness by the opposite party.
example: Cross examination exposed contradictions.

definition: Formal expression of final court decision in civil case.
example: Decree passed in favour of plaintiff.

definition: Harming someone's reputation by false statements.
example: He filed criminal defamation complaint.

definition: Abuse within domestic relationships under DV Act.
example: She sought protection order.

definition: Harassment relating to illegal dowry demands.
example: FIR registered for dowry harassment.

definition: Right to use another's land for specific purpose.
example: He had easement of way over neighbour's land.

definition: Order passed when opposite party is absent.
example: Court granted ex parte injunction.

definition: Material used to prove or disprove facts.
example: Electronic evidence requires Section 65B certificate.

definition: First Information Report given to police.
example: Police lodged FIR after complaint.

definition: Intentional deception causing loss.
example: Sale deed cancelled due to fraud.

definition: Court order requiring a third party to pay debt owed to judgment debtor.
example: Bank received a garnishee order freezing the account.

definition: Honest intention without fraud or negligence.
example: The buyer acted in good faith during the transaction.

definition: Person legally responsible for care of a minor.
example: The mother was appointed guardian.

definition: Court session where arguments are presented.
example: The matter is listed for final hearing tomorrow.

definition: Information not directly witnessed but reported by another.
example: Hearsay evidence is generally inadmissible.

definition: Killing of a person by another, lawful or unlawful.
example: The case involved culpable homicide.

definition: Land, buildings and things attached to earth.
example: Sale of immovable property requires registration.

definition: Legal protection from liability or prosecution.
example: Witness received immunity in exchange for testimony.

definition: Challenging credibility of a witness.
example: Defence counsel impeached the hostile witness.

definition: Private court proceedings closed to public.
example: Sexual offence trials are held in camera.

definition: Court order preventing or directing a specific act.
example: Court issued injunction on property sale.

definition: Inquiry into unnatural or suspicious death.
example: Police conducted inquest before postmortem.

definition: Order given during pendency of case, not final.
example: Interlocutory order allowed interim relief.

definition: A person dying without a will.
example: Property was divided as per intestate succession.

definition: Inquiry by police to collect evidence.
example: Investigation was transferred to special unit.

definition: Legal authority of a court to hear cases.
example: The court had no territorial jurisdiction.

definition: Group deciding guilt in a trial; abolished in India except in special cases.
example: India no longer uses jury trials.

definition: Delay in asserting rights leading to denial of relief.
example: The petition was dismissed due to laches.

definition: Contract allowing use of property for rent.
example: Lease deed was registered for 11 months.

definition: Defamation in written or published form.
example: Newspaper faced libel suit.

definition: Right to keep someone's property until debt is paid.
example: Mechanic had lien over the vehicle.

definition: Maximum time allowed to file a case.
example: Suit filed beyond limitation was dismissed.

definition: Process of taking legal action.
example: Family chose mediation over litigation.

definition: Financial support ordered by court, usually for spouse/children.
example: Court granted interim maintenance under Section 125 CrPC.

definition: Official document proving marriage.
example: Needed for divorce proceedings.

definition: Negotiated settlement process with mediator.
example: Parties agreed to mediation instead of trial.

definition: Person under age 18.
example: Court granted custody of minor to mother.

definition: Unlawful or improper behavior, especially by officials.
example: Departmental inquiry found misconduct.

definition: Loan secured by property offered as security.
example: Bank enforced mortgage on default.

definition: Formal request for a court order.
example: He filed a motion seeking early hearing.

definition: Principles ensuring fairness, such as right to be heard.
example: Order was quashed for violating natural justice.

definition: Failure to exercise reasonable care causing harm.
example: Hospital sued for medical negligence.

definition: Person appointed to receive benefits after death.
example: Insurance amount released to nominee.

definition: Police require court permission to arrest.
example: Defamation is non-cognizable.

definition: Authorized person certifying legal documents.
example: He notarized the affidavit.

definition: Formal protest raised during court proceeding.
example: Counsel raised objection to inadmissible evidence.

definition: Act punishable by law.
example: The act constituted a serious offence.

definition: Promise to tell truth in court.
example: Witness took oath before testimony.

definition: Daily record of court proceedings.
example: Order sheet noted absence of witness.

definition: Temporary law issued by President or Governor.
example: Government enacted ordinance on land reforms.

definition: Document recording details at crime scene.
example: Police prepared panchanama during raid.

definition: Temporary release of a prisoner for specific reasons.
example: He was granted parole for medical treatment.

definition: Document outlining rights and duties of business partners.
example: Partnership deed included capital contributions.

definition: Knowingly giving false evidence under oath.
example: Witness booked for perjury.

definition: Initial document filed by plaintiff in civil suit.
example: Plaint contained claim for damages.

definition: Accused agrees to lesser punishment by admitting guilt.
example: Court allowed plea bargaining in minor offences.

definition: Authorization allowing another person to act legally for someone.
example: She executed power of attorney in favour of her brother.

definition: At first glance; sufficient to establish fact unless disproved.
example: Court found prima facie case for trial.

definition: Public notice declaring accused as absconding.
example: Court issued proclamation under Section 82 CrPC.

definition: Order preventing lower authority from acting beyond jurisdiction.
example: High Court issued prohibition order.

definition: Written unconditional promise to pay a specified sum.
example: He filed a suit based on the promissory note.

definition: Legal proceedings against an accused in criminal law.
example: Prosecution failed to prove its case.

definition: To reject or void a legal proceeding or order.
example: High Court quashed the FIR.

definition: The extent or severity of punishment decided by court.
example: Court considered mitigating factors while deciding quantum.

definition: Authority with powers similar to a court.
example: The tribunal performs quasi-judicial functions.

definition: Approval of an act done without authority.
example: Company ratified the contract made by its director.

definition: Evidence or argument presented to counter the opponent.
example: Prosecution produced rebuttal evidence.

definition: Court appoints a receiver to manage property.
example: Property was placed under receivership due to dispute.

definition: Bond to ensure appearance in court.
example: Accused was released on recognizance.

definition: Judge withdrawing from a case due to conflict of interest.
example: Judge recused himself citing personal reasons.

definition: Response filed by plaintiff to defendant’s reply.
example: Plaintiff submitted rejoinder to counter allegations.

definition: Sending accused back to custody or ordering re-hearing.
example: Accused was remanded to judicial custody.

definition: Contract outlining terms of tenancy.
example: Rent agreement required police verification.

definition: Formal request or submission to authority.
example: Employee filed representation seeking reinstatement.

definition: Matter already judged cannot be re-litigated.
example: Suit dismissed due to res judicata.

definition: Restoring a party to original position.
example: Court ordered restitution of property.

definition: Order preventing a person from certain actions.
example: Restraining order issued in domestic violence case.

definition: Application seeking review of a lower court decision.
example: Revision petition filed under CrPC.

definition: Order requiring party to show cause why order shouldn’t be made absolute.
example: High Court issued rule nisi in writ petition.

definition: Official permission, often required to prosecute public servants.
example: Prosecution lacked sanction under Section 197 CrPC.

definition: Court order allowing police to search premises.
example: Search warrant issued for recovery of stolen items.

definition: High Court’s inherent powers to quash proceedings.
example: Petition filed under Section 482 CrPC.

definition: Confiscation of property or evidence.
example: Police recorded seizure memo.

definition: Punishment imposed by court.
example: He received five-year sentence.

definition: Delivering legal notice to concerned party.
example: Case delayed due to improper service of notice.

definition: To cancel or nullify a court order.
example: High Court set aside the conviction.

definition: Document transferring property without sale.
example: Father executed settlement deed in favor of children.

definition: Document proving ownership of company shares.
example: Investor presented share certificate.

definition: Order requiring person to explain why action should not be taken.
example: Employee received show cause notice.

definition: Formal ceremony of marriage under law.
example: Marriage solemnization required witnesses.

definition: Court orders a party to fulfill contractual obligations.
example: Buyer filed suit for specific performance.

definition: Tax on legal documents like property deeds.
example: Sale deed registered after stamp duty payment.

definition: Statement given to police during investigation.
example: Witness recorded 161 CrPC statement.

definition: Statement recorded before a Magistrate.
example: Victim's 164 statement supported prosecution.

definition: Order to maintain existing condition.
example: Court granted status quo on property.

definition: Temporary suspension of a court order.
example: High Court granted stay order.

definition: Matter pending before a court.
example: The issue is sub judice.

definition: Summons requiring appearance or production of documents.
example: Court issued subpoena to witness.

definition: Order requiring a person to appear in court.
example: Accused received summons for hearing.

definition: Person who guarantees performance or appearance.
example: Court accepted surety bond.

definition: Temporary removal from duties or enforcement.
example: Employee faced suspension pending inquiry.

definition: Short-term court order to maintain status quo.
example: Court granted temporary injunction on construction.

definition: Person renting property.
example: Tenant defaulted on monthly rent.

definition: Statement given under oath in court.
example: Witness testimony was crucial.

definition: Civil wrong causing injury or damage.
example: He filed a tort claim for negligence.

definition: Examination of evidence to determine guilt or liability.
example: Trial lasted two years.

definition: Unauthorized entry onto property.
example: Owner filed suit for trespass.

definition: Body established to decide specific disputes.
example: Employee filed case in service tribunal.

definition: Act beyond legal authority.
example: Order declared ultra vires.

definition: Formal promise given to court.
example: He filed undertaking not to dispossess tenant.

definition: Final decision on guilt or liability.
example: Court delivered verdict after hearing.

definition: Right legally enforceable without further conditions.
example: He had vested right to the property share.

definition: Statement describing harm suffered by victim.
example: Court considered victim impact statement.

definition: Agreement without legal effect.
example: Agreement lacking consideration was void.

definition: Contract valid until avoided by aggrieved party.
example: Contract obtained by coercion became voidable.

definition: Legal authorization for arrest, search or seizure.
example: Court issued non-bailable warrant.

definition: Legal declaration of a person's wishes after death.
example: Property distributed as per registered will.

definition: Person who gives evidence in court.
example: Witness turned hostile.

definition: Order issued by High Court/Supreme Court enforcing fundamental rights.
example: Filed writ petition challenging detention.

definition: Daily interim order passed during investigation or trial.
example: Court recorded zimni order for next date.

definition: Ending of a suit due to death or non-prosecution of a party.
example: Case abated due to non-substitution of legal heirs.

definition: Complete legal rights over property without restriction.
example: She enjoyed absolute ownership of the estate.

definition: Adjournment without specifying next date.
example: The matter was adjourned sine die.

definition: Supreme Court's power to give advisory opinions.
example: Matter was referred under advisory jurisdiction.

definition: Written evidence filed instead of oral testimony.
example: Plaintiff submitted affidavit of evidence.

definition: Factors increasing seriousness of offence.
example: Court considered aggravating circumstances in sentencing.

definition: Transfer of property rights.
example: Alienation without consent was challenged.

definition: Person assisting court without being a party.
example: Court appointed amicus curiae to assist.

definition: Accused's previous criminal record or reputation.
example: Court considered antecedents before granting bail.

definition: Dismissal of appeal at preliminary stage.
example: Appeal dismissed in limine due to lack of merit.

definition: Overdue payments not yet paid.
example: Tenant was liable for rent arrears.

definition: Seizing property before decree to prevent disposal.
example: Court ordered attachment before judgment.

definition: Written authorization for representation.
example: Bank required authority letter for transaction.

definition: Decision given by arbitrator or tribunal.
example: Arbitration award enforced by court.

definition: Person receiving benefit under trust or will.
example: Beneficiary claimed his share under will.

definition: Primary evidence must be produced when available.
example: Court rejected photocopy under best evidence rule.

definition: Standard of proof in criminal cases.
example: Prosecution must prove guilt beyond reasonable doubt.

definition: Police record of investigation.
example: Court called for case diary.

definition: Set of facts giving right to sue.
example: Suit dismissed for lack of cause of action.

definition: Official copy attested by court or authority.
example: He applied for certified copy of order.

definition: Final police report under Section 173 CrPC.
example: Police filed charge-sheet within 60 days.

definition: High Court review of lower court civil order.
example: Civil revision allowed in part.

definition: Final argument before judgment.
example: Advocate delivered closing statement.

definition: Evidence not directly relevant but supportive.
example: Court considered collateral evidence.

definition: Shared intention making all accused liable.
example: Section 34 IPC applied for common intention.

definition: Court having legal authority to hear a case.
example: Matter transferred to competent court.

definition: Court allows filing after limitation period.
example: Delay condoned due to valid reasons.

definition: Accused admitting guilt.
example: Confession recorded before magistrate.

definition: Fee payable to lawyer only upon success.
example: Contingency fee agreements not allowed in India.

definition: Person appointed to inspect, record or assist court.
example: Commissioner submitted inspection report.

definition: Complaint filed by defendant against plaintiff.
example: Defendant filed cross-complaint.

definition: Questioning of witness by opposite party.
example: Witness contradicted himself in cross-examination.

definition: Questioning accused while in police custody.
example: Court allowed custodial interrogation.

definition: Disallowing a person from rights or profession.
example: Employee faced debarment proceedings.

definition: Bail granted when charge-sheet not filed in time.
example: Accused entitled to default bail after 60 days.

definition: Person in whose favour decree is passed.
example: Decree holder executed the decree.

definition: Witness statement recorded under oath.
example: Deposition explained incident clearly.

definition: Keeping a person in custody.
example: He was placed under preventive detention.

definition: Releasing accused due to lack of evidence.
example: Court discharged him under Section 227 CrPC.

definition: Permanent residence determining legal rights.
example: Domicile certificate required for reservation.

definition: Petition challenging election result.
example: Election petition filed before High Court.

definition: Fraudulent misappropriation of property.
example: He was charged with embezzlement.

definition: Unauthorized occupation of land.
example: Municipality removed encroachment.

definition: Signature transferring negotiable instrument.
example: Cheque required proper endorsement.

definition: Non-monetary relief such as injunction.
example: Court granted equitable relief.

definition: Transfer of ownerless property to the state.
example: Unclaimed estate escheated to government.

definition: Enforcing forfeiture of bond.
example: Court estreated surety bond.

definition: Initial questioning of witness by the calling party.
example: Examination-in-chief lasted one hour.

definition: Application to enforce a decree.
example: Decree holder filed execution petition.

definition: Decree passed when defendant does not appear.
example: Ex-parte decree was later set aside.

definition: Making false documents with intent to cheat.
example: He was arrested for forgery.

definition: Transfer made to defeat creditors.
example: Court voided fraudulent transfer.

definition: Order directing third party to pay creditor.
example: Bank received garnishee order from court.

definition: Honest intention without negligence.
example: Act done in good faith is protected.

definition: Guardian appointed by court for minor in suit.
example: Court appointed guardian ad litem.

definition: Place where a person resides.
example: Accused's habitation was confirmed.

definition: Evidence based on what someone else said.
example: Court rejected hearsay evidence.

definition: Witness who contradicts earlier statements.
example: Witness declared hostile.

definition: Challenging witness credibility.
example: Defense sought impeachment of witness.

definition: A sentence lasting natural life unless remitted.
example: He was sentenced to imprisonment for life.

definition: At the threshold; at the start of proceedings.
example: Petition dismissed in limine.

definition: Bond ensuring compliance with injunction.
example: Court required injunction bond.

definition: Application seeking interim relief.
example: Interlocutory application allowed by court.

definition: Risk of conviction during trial.
example: Double jeopardy prohibits second trial.

definition: Court acting beyond legal authority.
example: Order quashed due to jurisdictional error.

definition: Document proving relationship with deceased.
example: Widow applied for legal heir certificate.

definition: Authority to administer estate when no will exists.
example: Court issued letter of administration.

definition: Maximum time allowed to file suit or appeal.
example: Appeal filed beyond limitation.

definition: Person engaged in a lawsuit.
example: Litigant sought early hearing.

definition: Inquiry conducted by magistrate into incidents like deaths or violence.
example: Magisterial inquiry ordered in custodial death.

definition: Guilty mind or criminal intent.
example: Mens rea must be proved in theft.

definition: Factors reducing severity of punishment.
example: Youth considered mitigating circumstance.

definition: Issue irrelevant due to changed circumstances.
example: Petition dismissed as infructuous due to mootness.

definition: Person legally recognized as guardian by nature of relationship.
example: Mother is natural guardian after father.

definition: Person authorized to receive property on behalf of others.
example: Nominee received insurance amount.

definition: Temporary performance of duties of another post.
example: He served in officiating capacity.

definition: Doctrine where state protects those unable to care for themselves.
example: Court acted under parens patriae for child's welfare.

definition: Statutes dealing with same subject must be interpreted similarly.
example: Both laws are in pari materia.

definition: Giving false statement under oath.
example: He was prosecuted for perjury.

definition: Permanent court order preventing an act.
example: Perpetual injunction granted over disputed land.

definition: During the pendency of a suit or proceeding.
example: Interim maintenance awarded pendente lite.

definition: On the other hand; in reply or opposition.
example: The respondent filed a per contra affidavit.

definition: Formal written application to a court or authority.
example: He filed a petition under Section 482 CrPC.

definition: Written complaint initiating a civil suit.
example: Plaint admitted for consideration by the court.

definition: Formal written statements of parties' claims or defenses.
example: Court struck out defective pleadings.

definition: Physical control over property or goods.
example: Adverse possession claim required continuous possession.

definition: Document authorizing a person to act on another's behalf.
example: He executed a power of attorney for sale of land.

definition: Earlier court decision used as authority for later cases.
example: The judge relied on binding precedent.

definition: Standard of proof in civil cases — more likely than not.
example: Plaintiff must prove claim by preponderance of evidence.

definition: On first appearance; sufficient at first sight unless rebutted.
example: There is a prima facie case for trial.

definition: Legal work undertaken voluntarily and without payment.
example: Counsel accepted the matter pro bono.

definition: Judicial process recognizing the validity of a will.
example: He applied for probate to administer the estate.

definition: Act or event that primarily brings about a result (often used in agency/real estate).
example: Dispute arose over procuring cause of sale.

definition: (Latin) Presentation of truth; producing truthful evidence.
example: The witness's prodcutio veritatis strengthened the case.

definition: Writ preventing a lower court from exceeding jurisdiction.
example: High Court issued prohibition to restrain trial court.

definition: Written unconditional promise to pay a sum of money.
example: Bank sued on dishonoured promissory note.

definition: Document proving that legal documents were served on a party.
example: Case adjourned for want of proof of service.

definition: Monetary award to punish defendant and deter misconduct.
example: Court awarded punitive damages for fraud.

definition: Payment owed for services rendered where no contract exists.
example: Contractor claimed quantum meruit for extra work.

definition: To set aside or annul an order or proceeding.
example: High Court quashed the prosecution's complaint.

definition: Obligation imposed by law to prevent unjust enrichment.
example: Court imposed liability under quasi-contract principles.

definition: Minimum number of members required to transact business.
example: Bench lacked quorum; hearing adjourned.

definition: Confirmation of an act subsequently accepted by the principal.
example: Employer's ratification validated agent's act.

definition: Withdrawal of a judge or official from a case due to bias or conflict.
example: Judge recused himself for impartiality.

definition: Transfer of property back to the grantor, often after mortgage repayment.
example: Bank issued reconveyance on closure of loan.

definition: Right to claim reimbursement or remedy from another party.
example: Bank had recourse against guarantor.

definition: Cancellation of sale due to hidden defects (consumer law concept).
example: Buyer sought redhibition for defect in goods.

definition: To send a case back to a lower court for further action.
example: Supreme Court remanded the matter for fresh inquiry.

definition: Sending a case or record back to a lower court.
example: High Court ordered remittal for reconsideration.

definition: Revocation or annulment of a law by legislative action.
example: The statute was repealed by new legislation.

definition: Matter already judged; bar to re-litigation of same cause.
example: Claim dismissed due to res judicata.

definition: The thing speaks for itself — doctrine inferring negligence from facts.
example: In surgery case, res ipsa loquitur applied.

definition: Restoring a person to the position before wrongful act.
example: Court ordered restitution of misappropriated funds.

definition: Court order restricting a party from certain actions (temporary or permanent).
example: Temporary restraining order issued against defendant.

definition: Loan allowing homeowners to access equity while retaining title, repaid later.
example: Elderly couple considered a reverse mortgage.

definition: Ready for judicial review; not premature.
example: Issue not ripe for adjudication.

definition: Old term for a forged will or spurious title (rare).
example: Court rejected the rognor offered in evidence.

definition: A court order to show cause why a certain action should not be taken.
example: Court issued rule nisi for contempt proceedings.

definition: Conveyance document effecting transfer of ownership in immovable property.
example: Parties executed a registered sale deed.

definition: Writ requiring a person to show why a judgment should not be enforced.
example: Court issued scire facias in the matter.

definition: Possession of land under freehold; legal possession.
example: Plaintiff claimed seisin since 1990.

definition: Formal delivery of legal documents to give notice of proceedings.
example: Service of process completed by registered post.

definition: Right to reduce mutual debts by offsetting amounts owed.
example: Defendant raised a set-off against the claim.

definition: Agreement resolving dispute without further litigation.
example: Parties reached an out-of-court settlement.

definition: Equitable remedy compelling fulfillment of contractual obligation.
example: Seller ordered to perform specific performance of sale contract.

definition: Court order temporarily suspending a proceeding or enforcement.
example: Supreme Court granted stay on execution of decree.

definition: Under judicial consideration and therefore prohibited from public discussion in certain contexts.
example: Media advised not to comment on sub judice matters.

definition: Order requiring a person to attend court or produce documents.
example: Witness served with subpoena to appear in court.

definition: Official notice to a defendant to appear and answer a suit.
example: Summons returned served on the defendant.

definition: Person who guarantees another's performance or appearance.
example: Surety forfeited bond when accused absconded.

definition: Unique; of its own kind.
example: Landmark judgement created a sui generis remedy.

definition: Additional charge or penalty imposed by court or authority.
example: Audit led to surcharge against trustee.

definition: Schedule of charges or fees (often spelled 'tariff').
example: Court registry updated fee tariff for filings.
